page.title: 09Communications,5 Rds
page.content: The most important roadway that serves the area is the B4309.At Five Roads it is crossed by an unclassified road that was once used by cattle drovers. West of the Gwendraeth Valley was the road for transporting coal and limestone to West Wales while the section from the Gwendraeth Valley to Llanelli linked the mining valley to Llanelli.The fifth road rejoins the B4309 at Cynheidre.The bus service is run by The South Wales Bus Company who have reduced the service to a two hourly service because of the drop in passengers.The Llanelly and Mynydd Mawr Railway never had a scheduled passenger service apart from colliers' trains.Goods traffic has never competed with road distribution yet the line is a major artery into the Llanelli hinterland.Road use today is mainly commuter and tourist orientated
